tit.e: Kyogen (farce played during a Noh play cycle)

sen.j: 狂言（きょうげん）は、能と同様に猿楽から発展した伝統芸能である。
sen.e: Kyogen is a traditional public entertainment developed from Sarugaku (comical mimicry and speech performance in Heian period) like Noh.

sen.j: 猿楽の滑稽味を洗練させた笑劇。
sen.e: Kyogen, with more sophisticated comical element than Sarugaku, is classified into theatrical farce.

sen.j: 明治時代以降は、能・式三番と併せて能楽と呼ぶことがある。
sen.e: Since the Meiji period, Kyogen, Noh and Shiki Sanba (a dance to celebrate a memorial day, particularly in Kabuki) all together have frequently been called Nohgaku (the art of Noh).

sen.j: 狂言は、道理に合わない物言いや飾り立てた言葉を意味する仏教用語の「狂言綺語」（きょうげんきぎょ）に由来する。
sen.e: The word "Kyogen" is derived from a Buddhist terminology 'Kyogen Kigo' that means an unreasonable phrase and a decorative word.
The word "Kyogen" is derived from a Buddhist term 'Kyogen Kigo' that means an unreasonable phrase and a decorative word.
The word "Kyogen" is derived from a Buddhist term 'Kyogen Kigo' that means an unreasonable phrase and a decorative word.

sen.j: この語は主に小説や詩などを批評する際に用いられた(例願以今生世俗文字業狂言綺語之誤 翻為当来世々讃仏乗之因転法輪之縁 白楽天)。
sen.e: This Buddhist terminology was mainly used to criticize novels, poems and so on (for example, Bai Letian said, "Having been absorbed in worldly literature, I have made mistakes to lure people by using 'Kyogen Kigo.' Recognizing such a sin, I would like to admire Buddhism and devote myself to enlighten people by delivering sermons in the next life.").

sen.j: アドが複数登場する場合は、一のアド、二のアドと称したりする。
sen.e: When several Ado appear on the stage, they are distinguished by calling "Ichi-no-Ado" (the first Ado), "Ni-no-Ado" (the second Ado).

sen.e: Besides, there are other ways to call several Ado separately; the most important performer playing the supporting role is called Ado, while others are called "Ji-Ado" (the next ranked Ado), "Omo" (title used only in the Okura school), "Ko-Ado" (title used only in the Izumi school) and so on.

sen.j: 過去に大蔵流から人間国宝に認定されたのは善竹弥五郎（茂山久治）、3世・茂山千作（真一。11世・茂山千五郎）、4世・茂山千作（七五三しめ。12世・茂山千五郎。現役）の3人。
sen.e: In the past, three Kyogen performers belonging to the Okura school received the honors of the Living National Treasure, Yagoro ZENCHIKU (Kyuji SHIGEYAMA), Sensaku SHIGEYAMA, the third (real name, Shinichi, and also Sengoro SHIGEYAMA, the 11th) and Sensaku SHIGEYAMA, the fourth (real name, Shime, and also Sengoro SHIGEYAMA, the 15th, a Kyogen performer on the active list).

sen.j: 大蔵彌右衛門家
sen.e: The Yaemon OKURA family
The Yaemon OKURA family
The Yaemon OKURA family

sen.j: 家伝によれば、大蔵流は14世紀に後醍醐天皇の侍講を勤めていた比叡山の学僧・玄恵法印を流祖とする。
sen.e: According to the family record, Gene Hoin, a scholar monk of Mt. Hiei was the founder of the Okura school, who was a Jiko (teacher) of the Emperor Godaigo in the 14th century.
According to the family record, Gene Hoin, a scholar monk of Mt. Hiei was the founder of the Okura school, who was a Jiko (teacher) of the Emperor Godaigo in the 14th century.

sen.j: 玄恵は戦争の打ち続く不安定な時代において、立派な人格の養成と人としての生きる道を説くために狂言を創始したという。
sen.e: It is believed that Gene created Kyogen aiming to form a fine personality as well as to preach the path of humanity in the times of uncertainty filled with relentless conflicts.

sen.j: その狂言は坂本在住で近江猿楽の猿楽師であった2世・日吉彌兵衛に伝えられ、3世・彌太郎、4世・彌次兵衛、5世・彌右衛門と受け継がれた。
sen.e: The Kyogen was passed down to Yahe HIYOSHI, the second, who was a Sarugaku performer of Omi Sarugaku living in Sakamoto, and then to Yataro, the third, Yajibe, the fourth and Yaemon, the fifth in that order.

sen.j: 6世・彌太郎の代には大和猿楽金春座に属した。
sen.e: The family belonged to the Konparu troupe of Yamato-Sarugaku troupe in the period of Yataro, the sixth.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。前列同様に金春は「こんぱる」と訳しました。

sen.j: 7世・彌右衛門の後に世阿弥の外孫にあたる8世・金春四郎次郎が芸系を受け継いだ。
sen.e: After the Yaemon the seventh period, Shirojiro KONPARU, the eighth, a sotomago (a grandchild from a daughter married into another family) of Zeami, inherited the artistic tradition of the school.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。前列同様に金春は「こんぱる」と訳しました。

sen.j: 四郎次郎の死後、吉野猿楽出身の日吉万五郎が一時家を継いだが、最終的には養子の宇治彌太郎が9世を継いだ。、
sen.e: After Shirojiro's death, Mangoro HIYOSHI, originally from the Yoshino-Sarugaku troupe temporarily inherited the family, however, an adopted son Yataro UJI ultimately inherited the family as the ninth family head.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。

sen.j: 10世・彌右衛門の代に「大蔵」と姓を改めた。
sen.e: In the Yaemon, the 10th period, the family newly took the family name 'Okura.'
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。

sen.j: 11世・彌右衛門は織田信長より虎の字を拝領し虎政と名乗った。
sen.e: Yaemon, the 11th named himself Toramasa after being bestowed the Chinese character "虎" (a tiger, pronounced 'tora') from Nobunaga ODA.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。

sen.j: その子12世・彌右衛門は虎清と名乗り豊臣秀吉・徳川家康に仕えた。
sen.e: His son Yaemon, the 12th named himself Torakiyo, and served Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI and Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。

sen.j: 13世・彌右衛門虎明（とらあきら）は万治3年（1660年）大蔵流最古の狂言伝書『わらんべ草』を著わした。
sen.e: In 1660, Yaemon Toraakira, the 13th wrote "Waranbe gusa" (literally, Young Leaves) that was the oldest Kyogen-densho (esoteric book on Kyogen) in the Okura school.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。

sen.j: 元禄7年（1694年）になると5代将軍徳川綱吉の上意により江戸屋敷を拝領し、それまでの奈良住まいから江戸住まいとなった。
sen.e: In 1694, Yaemon received a residence in Edo with an order issued by the fifth Shogun Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA, and he moved from Nara to Edo.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。

sen.j: その後も22世・彌太郎虎年まで代々幕府の俸禄を受け、最古の伝統を持つ大蔵流の宗家として狂言を着々と守り続けてきた。
sen.e: Afterward, receiving Horoku (salary) from the Bakufu for generations until the period headed by Yataro Toratoshi, the 22nd, the family steadily maintained Kyogen as the head family of the Okura school with the oldest tradition.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Afterward, receiving Horoku (salary) from the Bakufu for generations until the period headed by Yataro Toratoshi, the 22nd, the family steadily maintained Kyogen as the head family of the Okura school with the oldest tradition.

Afterward, receiving Horoku (salary) from the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) for generations until the period headed by Yataro Toratoshi, the 22nd, the family steadily maintained Kyogen as the head family of the Okura school with the oldest tradition.

sen.j: しかし明治維新により大きな打撃を受ける。
sen.e: However, the family was hard hit by the Meiji Restoration.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, the family was hard hit by the Meiji Restoration.

sen.j: 徳川幕府や諸大名のお抱えとして、長年にわたり手厚い庇護を受けていた大蔵流の狂言師たちはみな俸禄を失い、転業・転職を余儀なくされた。
sen.e: Every Kyogen performer, who had been retained and cordially supported by the Tokugawa shogunate and many Daimyo over long periods, lost Horoku, with the result that they had no choice but to change their jobs.

Every Kyogen performer, who had been retained and cordially supported by the Tokugawa shogunate and many Daimyo over long periods, lost Horoku, with the result that they had no choice but to change their jobs.

sen.j: 宗家もその例外ではなかった。
sen.e: The head family was no exception.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The head family was no exception.

sen.j: 明治維新後奈良に移住していた虎年が明治14年（1881年）に41歳で死去すると、跡を継いだ23世・虎一はわずか2年で能楽界を去った。
sen.e: After Toratoshi died at the age of 41 in 1881, who had moved to Nara after the Meiji Restoration, Toraichi, the 23rd inherited the family, but he left the Nohgaku circles only after two years.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。

sen.j: その結果大蔵宗家は断絶するに至った。
sen.e: As a result, the Okura head family became extinct.

sen.j: さらに太平洋戦争の終戦後も復興を待つまでの間、長い暗黒の時代が続くことになった。
sen.e: After the end of the World War II, they also had to endure the long lasted gloomy period until Japan accomplished the postwar rehabilitation.
After the end of World War II, they also had to endure the long gloomy period until Japan accomplished postwar rehabilitation.

sen.j: しかしその間も山本東次郎や茂山千五郎といった大蔵流の狂言師たちは己の芸を磨き、後世に大蔵流の狂言を伝えていった。
sen.e: However, during those gloomy periods, Kyogen performers of the Okura school such as Tojiro YAMAMOTO and Sengoro SHIGEYAMA improved their skills to hand down the Kyogen of the Okura school to subsequent generations.

sen.j: そして昭和16年（1941年）、善竹彌五郎（当時・茂山久治）の次男・吉二が虎年の娘の外孫にあたる安と結婚し、24世彌太郎（のち彌右衛門）を名乗り、宗家を再興した。
sen.e: In 1941, Kichijiro, the second son of Yagoro ZENCHIKU (Kyuji SHIGEYAMA at that time) got married to Yasu, a sotomago of Toratoshi's daughter, assuming the post of the family head as Yataro OKURA, the 24th (later Yaemon) to restore the head family.
sen.cmt: 前列では吉次郎になっていたため吉次郎として訳しました。

In 1941, Kichijiro, the second son of Yagoro ZENCHIKU (Kyuji SHIGEYAMA at that time), married Yasu, a sotomago of Toratoshi's daughter, assuming the post of the family head as Yataro OKURA, the 24th (later Yaemon) to restore the head family.

sen.j: 現在大蔵家では24世の長男で宗家25世を継いだ大蔵彌太郎（基嗣）と弟の吉次郎（基義）、そして彼らの子である大蔵千太郎（25世の長男）・大蔵基誠（25世の次男）、大蔵教義（吉次郎の長男）の五人が大蔵の名を名乗り東京を中心に活躍している。
sen.e: At present, five family members, Yataro OKURA (Mototsugu) who is the oldest son of Yataro OKURA, the 24th and assumed the post of the 25th family head, Mototsugu's younger brother Kichijiro (Motoyoshi), and their children Sentaro OKURA (the oldest son of the 25th family head), Motonari OKURA (the second son of the 25th family head) and Noriyoshi OKURA (the oldest son of Kichijiro), perform Kyogen under the name of Okura mainly in Tokyo.
sen.cmt: 25世の次男の名前が抜けていましたのでウェブで確認し追加しました。
sen.e: At present, five family members, Yataro OKURA (Mototsugu), who is the oldest son of Yataro OKURA, the 24th and assumed the post of the 25th family head; Mototsugu's younger brother Kichijiro (Motoyoshi); and their children Sentaro OKURA (the oldest son of the 25th family head), Motonari OKURA (the second son of the 25th family head), and Noriyoshi OKURA (the oldest son of Kichijiro), perform Kyogen under the name of Okura, mainly in Tokyo.

sen.j: 和泉流は、江戸極初期に京都の手猿楽師（てさるがくし。素人出身の職業狂言師）として禁裏御用を勤めつつ、尾張藩主徳川義直に召し抱えられていた7世山脇和泉守元宜が、同輩の三宅藤九郎家、野村又三郎家を傘下に収めて創流した。
sen.e: With dominating his colleagues, the Tokuro MIYAKE family and the Matasaburo NOMURA family, Yamawaki Izumi no Kami Motoyoshi, the seventh established the Izumi school soon after the Edo period came, who was an official Tesarugaku-shi (a professional Sarugaku performer who was originally an outsider) in the Imperial Palace living in Kyoto, as well as a retainer of the Lord of Owari Domain Yoshinao TOKUGAWA.
sen.cmt: 後列から文章を移動させたうえで一文として訳しました。
sen.e: While dominating his colleagues, the Tokuro MIYAKE family and the Matasaburo NOMURA family, Yamawaki Izumi no Kami Motoyoshi, the seventh established the Izumi school soon after the Edo period came, and was an official Tesarugaku-shi (a professional Sarugaku performer who was originally an outsider) in the Imperial Palace living in Kyoto, as well as a retainer of the Lord of Owari Domain Yoshinao TOKUGAWA.

While dominating his colleagues, the Tokuro MIYAKE family and the Matasaburo NOMURA family, Yamawaki Izumi no Kami Motoyoshi, the seventh established the Izumi school soon after the Edo period came, and was an official Tesarugaku-shi (a professional Sarugaku performer who was originally an outsider) in the Imperial Palace living in Kyoto, as well as a retainer of the Lord of Owari Domain Yoshinao TOKUGAWA.

sen.j: 宗家は山脇和泉家。
sen.e: The head family was the Izumi YAMAWAKI family.
The head family was the Izumi YAMAWAKI family.
The head family was the Izumi YAMAWAKI family.

sen.j: もっとも、一応家元制度を取っていたとは言え、三派合同で流儀を形成したという過去の経緯もあって、近世を通じて家元の力は弱かった。
sen.e: The school had introduced the Iemoto system, however, the head family was little influential through the early modern age due to the background that the above-mentioned three families jointly decided the school style.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。後列から文章を移動させたうえで分割し直しました。
sen.e: The school had introduced the Iemoto system, however, the head family was little influential through the early modern age due to the background that the above-mentioned three families jointly decided the school style.

The school had introduced the Iemoto system, however, the head family was little influential through the early modern age due to the background that the above-mentioned three families jointly decided the school style.

sen.j: とりわけ三宅藤九郎家と野村又三郎家は独自の六義（りくぎ。和泉流における狂言台本の称）を持てるという特権を有するなど、一定の独自性を保っていた。
sen.e: Especially, the Tokuro MIYAKE family and the Matasaburo NOMURA family were allowed to maintain their individualities; for example, they had the privilege of possessing their original Rikugi (Kyogen scripts, a jargon exclusively used in the Izumi school).
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。

sen.j: 元禄9年（1696年）に家元が名古屋に移住してからは名古屋を本拠とした。
sen.e: After the head family moved to Nagoya in 1696, the school was based in Nagoya.
After the head family moved to Nagoya in 1696, the school was based in Nagoya.

sen.j: その後も禁裏御用は相変わらず勤めてはいた。
sen.e: The Izumi school served as an official Kyogen school in the Imperial Palace as before.
The Izumi school served as an official Kyogen school in the Imperial Palace as before.
The Izumi school served as an official Kyogen school in the Imperial Palace as before.
sen.cmt: 原文が「たが、」となっていたため、「た。」と変更しました。

sen.j: しかし、四座に属し幕府御用を勤めていた鷺・大蔵二流に比べれば、明治以前の和泉流は名古屋（宗家、野村又三郎家）・京都・金沢（三宅藤九郎家）を中心として活動する地方流儀に過ぎなかった。
sen.e: However, compared with the two other main schools, the Sagi school and the Okura school serving as official Kyogen schools in the Shogun's court by belonging to Yoza (four troupes of Kyogen), the Izumi school before the Meiji period was no more than a local school performing Kyogen in and around Nagoya (base for the head family and the Matasaburo NOMURA family), Kyoto and Kanazawa (base for the Tokuro MIYAKE family).

However, compared with the two other main schools, the Sagi school and the Okura school serving as official Kyogen schools in the Shogun's court by belonging to Yoza (four troupes of Kyogen), the Izumi school before the Meiji period was no more than a local school performing Kyogen in and around Nagoya (base for the head family and the Matasaburo NOMURA family), Kyoto, and Kanazawa (base for the Tokuro MIYAKE family).

However, compared with the two other main schools, the Sagi school and the Okura school serving as official Kyogen schools in the Shogun's court by belonging to Yoza (four troupes of Kyogen), the Izumi school before the Meiji period was no more than a local school performing Kyogen in and around Nagoya (base for the head family and the Matasaburo NOMURA family), Kyoto, and Kanazawa (base for the Tokuro MIYAKE family).
sen.cmt: 上記との関連で「However」で始まるため、原文にも「しかし」を追記しました。

sen.j: しかるに、明治維新によって立場は逆転。
sen.e: However, the tide turned in the Izumi school's favor after the Meiji Restoration.
However, the tide turned in the Izumi school's favor after the Meiji Restoration.
However, the tide turned in the Izumi school's favor after the Meiji Restoration.

sen.j: 禁裏御用を勤めていた縁により、家元をはじめとする職分の多くが東京に移住した。
sen.e: Not only the head family but also many occupational branch families moved to Tokyo taking advantage of the history that the Izumi school had long served as an official Kyogen school in the Imperial Palace.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。

sen.j: 幕府側であった鷺・大蔵二流が相次いで没落するのを尻目に、和泉流ひとりが東京の狂言界を席巻した。
sen.e: As a result, the Izumi school monopolized the Kyogen performance in Tokyo, despite successive downfall of the two schools, the Sagi school and the Okura school, which had taken sides with Bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 大正11年（1922年）に最後の鷺流狂言師であった鷺畔翁（晩年は鷺流宗家を自称した）の死去により、能楽協会に所属する流派として廃絶するに至った。
sen.e: The Sagi school was eliminated from the school list belonging to the Nohgaku Performers' Association after Bano SAGI (called himself the family head of the Sagi school in his last years), the last Kyogen performer of the Sagi school died in 1922.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The Sagi school was eliminated from the school list belonging to the Nohgaku Performers' Association after Bano SAGI (who called himself the family head of the Sagi school in his last years), the last Kyogen performer of the Sagi school, died in 1922.

The Sagi school was eliminated from the school list belonging to the Nohgaku Performers' Association after Bano SAGI (who called himself the family head of the Sagi school in his last years), the last Kyogen performer of the Sagi school, died in 1922.

sen.j: なお、鷺流の狂言自体は山口県山口市（伝右衛門派、県指定無形文化財）、新潟県佐渡市（仁右衛門派、県指定文化財）、佐賀県神埼市千代田町高志（たかし）地区（高志狂言という名称で県指定無形民俗文化財として）などに残っている。
sen.e: However, the Kyogen of the Sagi school remains in Yamaguchi City, Yamaguchi Prefecture (Kyogen of Denemon line is performed, registered as the intangible cultural properties designated by Prefecture), in Sado City, Niigata Prefecture (Kyogen of Denemon line is performed, registered as the cultural properties designated by Prefecture), in Takashi area, Chiyoda-cho, Kanzaki City, Saga Prefecture (Kyogen performed in this area is called Takashi Kyogen, registered as the intangible cultural properties designated by Prefecture).

sen.j: 国立能楽堂などで上演されたこともある。
sen.e: Kyogen of the Sagi school was performed at National Noh Theatre and other facilities.

sen.j: また、鷺畔翁をはじめ能楽界を追放された鷺流狂言師たちは歌舞伎界に接近した。
sen.e: Meanwhile, Kyogen performers of the Sagi school expelled from Nohgaku circles, including Bano SAGI, made an approach to the Kabuki circles.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。

sen.j: 「松羽目物」と言われる能楽写しの舞踊劇の演出に多大な影響を与えた。
sen.e: They exerted a great influence on the dramaturgy of dance drama modeled after Nohgaku that is called 'Matsubamemono' (performance in front of a panel with a picture of pine trees).

sen.j: その意味では、鷺流の歌舞伎界に与えた影響は決して小さなものではない。
sen.e: In that sense, the Sagi school exerted not a little influence on the Kabuki circles.
